about_the_game:
Reduce, reuse and recycle

Have you ever wondered how much waste is recycled every day? Do you know how the process looks? Well, let’s start from the beginning. Because at first, the litter has to be… SORTED!

Become a professional waste sorter and make a difference in the world in this fast-paced arcade game. Take the responsibility for the first and most important stage of recycling - sorting. Separate plastic from glass, paper from metal, and recyclable materials from non-reusable waste.

Keep calm and find valuables

Recycling is not a one-time deal gig. You need to watch the sorting belt with caution to not miss any of the recyclable materials. Plastic, glass, paper, metal - it’s all mixed up there. In different forms, different shapes, and different colors. Bottles, newspapers, plastic packages, cans, paper bags… and it’s all just the tip of the iceberg. You can also find various valuables that someone threw away, starting from money and jewelry, to finishing with unique collectibles. So put waste in the right place and start the machine of change that you want to see in the world.

Don’t be fooled, though. It won’t be enough to “just” sort them out to proper bins.
Because SORTED! puts you up to the challenge…

Sort together and catch the pace

Enjoy the cooperative experience with a local multiplayer! Break the record by throwing litter into proper bins and hitting combo! Feel the rhythm while the sorting belt keeps speeding up more and more! Optimize your flow! Find a way to be the most efficient and earn points for each correct match. Become the best of all sorters while having fun with friends.

A small change can make a big difference

Proper garbage segregation plays a vital role in making the world a better place. What was a novelty 30 years ago now is a global standard. Although recycling awareness increases, there is still a huge range of possibilities regarding our planet's well-being. After all, the Earth is what we all have in common.
That's why SORTED! introduces you to the first and most important part of the recycling process - sorting. Without it, we wouldn't be able to reuse plastic, glass, paper, metal, and so many other reusable resources.
